page.title: 03Stithians C.P. School
page.content: Our school is over a hundred years old. When it was first built the girls and boys were in separate schools. There are about hundred and fifty pupils in the school aged four and half to eleven. At eleven, children go to Redruth comprehensive school. We have five full-time teachers and a head teacher but we are losing a part time teacher because of council cuts. There are five classes, a hall, a staff room and a library. Amongst the lessons we do in school are English, maths, history, story writing, science, geography, map reading and reading. We have a BBC computer. Our school is a happy school and it is not as strict as it used to be when the boys were not allowed to talk to the girls and the cane was used all the time for silly things like talking in class.
